pros: Flexible working, great colleagues who support each other. Annual leave entitlement and hybrid working (if you are in the right business area!)
cons: Challenging times due to being a newly merged organisation, processes and IT systems yet to be aligned which is making it difficult to deliver decent services to residents. Feels like a dictatorship, being told how to speak, which words we can and ‘can’t’ use. We are not robots, we are individuals that truly care about our residents so why not value us as individuals and allow us to communicate in our own style instead of worrying about language. Lack of clarity on job roles and responsibilities across directorates makes it challenging to gather information in a timely manner, this is preventing us from delivering excellent customer services. We are not able to give clear response times and are certainly not setting realistic expectations at the first point in contact. Repairs services are terrible and this reflects badly on Southern Housing and the employees trying so desperately to help residents. We need direction, too many colleagues are confused about who is responsible for what, this is frustrating for colleagues responding to residents and nobody is held accountable for not responding to residents or their complaints. Culture needs a lot of work. Insensitive director who shows no empathy for those colleagues being relocated from Spire Court.
Pay is not great could be better
